column2: April 29]], [[1926]]) is a London-born actor. He changed his stagename to '''Leonard Fenton''' during the Second World War, because his Jewish surname was [[Tolkein
column3: associated with Germany]]. His most famous role is that of [http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/characters_cast/characters/character_dr_l.shtml Dr. Harold Legg] in ''Eastenders'', but has also played in many radio plays.
